revised_title: Investigating the Electrolysis of Dilute Sulphuric Acid and Other Hydrated Salts
tldr: The authors examine the electrolysis of dilute sulphuric acid and other hydrated salts, finding that the electrolytic method is unable to determine the composition of hydrates in aqueous solutions. They also investigate the chemical changes that occur during the electrolysis of copper sulphate and zinc sulphate solutions, concluding that the method cannot accurately determine the presence of hydrated salts in these solutions.
